content.description:
Aut hoc inclusiincludo, -ere, -clusi, -clusum: to enclose lignolignum, -i, n.: wood occultanturocculto, -are: to hide AchiviAchivi, -orum, m. = Danai, -orum, 
aut haec inin, prep. (+ acc.): against nostros fabricata estfabricato, -are, -avi, -atum = facio, -ere machina muros, 
inspectura domos venturaque desuperdesuper, adv.: from above urbiurbi = “into the city”, 
aut aliquis latetlateo, -ere: to lie hidden  errorerror, -is, n.: deception. Equo ne credite, Teucri.
content.question: In line 2, haec in nostros fabricata est machina muros is translated

choices.label: this woman is making a machine against our walls
these walls have been made against our machine
the machine is made against these walls of ours
this machine has been made against our walls

content.answer: this machine has been made against our walls

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
